On this POW/MIA Recognition Day, we remember the service of POWs that returned home, as well as those who remain missing in action whose families are seeking closure. Freedom is not free. 🇺🇸 https://t.co/9J86F0KOVz

I commend the President for his decisive action to attack Iran’s nuclear program. I also commend the bravery and skill of our warfighters who participated in this important mission. 

There was no scenario in which Iran could be allowed to continue their nuclear weapons program. The time is now for the Iranian people to rise up against the radical regime.

Israel has an inherent right to self-defense, and the United States must stand firm in our support as Israel continues to fight to protect all people from Iranian nuclear threats.

No one benefits, especially the people of Iran, from the development of an Iranian nuclear weapon. I applaud the bravery and strength of the Israel Defense Forces as they work to halt the Iranian regime.

Under no circumstances should Iran target the U.S.!

Yesterday, @SecRollins  testified before the House Agriculture Committee. We discussed her continued efforts to eliminate waste, fraud, and abuse in Biden-era Inflation Reduction Act programs that fall under the USDA’s jurisdiction.

Secretary Rollins also assured me the crucial funding for disaster relief block grants will be rolled out in the coming weeks, providing essential relief for many farmers in GA-08. I look forward to continuing to work with Secretary Rollins’ administration on ensuring efficiency in USDA programs.

81 years ago, courageous Americans joined by our allies stormed the beaches of Normandy to liberate Europe from the Nazis as part of Operation Overlord. This was the beginning of the end of World War II in Europe.

Today, please take a moment to remember the sacrifices of these brave soldiers, sailors, and airmen who gave us the freedoms we enjoy today through their heroism. We honor those who served and those who gave their lives on this historic day.

Happy Memorial Day! Today, we pause to remember the brave men and women who made the ultimate sacrifice to defend our freedoms. Their courage ensured that we continue to live in a nation defined by liberty and justice. 

As we gather with family and friends, let us reflect on the impact of their service. Their legacy lives on in the values we uphold and the opportunities we cherish.

May this day serve as a reminder of the debt we owe to those who have given all. Let us honor their memory by striving to build a future worthy of their sacrifice.

I pray for the families of the two Israeli embassy staffers who were murdered in front of the Capital Jewish Museum in D.C. last night.

This was a clear antisemitic hate crime, and the shooter should be prosecuted to the fullest extent of the law.

Early this morning, the House passed One, Big, Beautiful Bill with my support. This legislation includes the first updated reference prices for our farmers since 2018, which is a huge and overdue relief for the agricultural industry. 

Vital tax relief for all Americans was in this legislation, including my provision to give some tax relief to combat-disabled Purple Heart recipients so they are not penalized for re-entering the workforce by giving them a one-year tax credit to make up for any loss of Social Security Disability Insurance (SSDI) benefits that they are entitled to. 

This bill is a victory for America's farmers, veterans, and taxpayers, and I urge the Senate to pass it quickly.

Establishing the Ocmulgee Mounds and surrounding areas as Georgia's first National Park and Preserve remains a top bipartisan initiative this Congress.

@SanfordBishop and I, along with @SenOssoff and @SenatorWarnock, reintroduced the Ocmulgee Mounds National Park and Preserve Establishment Act, which would establish the Ocmulgee Mounds and surrounding areas in Middle Georgia as Georgia's first National Park and Preserve.

The Ocmulgee Mounds are of invaluable cultural, communal, and economic significance to our state, and I am committed to keeping this initiative moving forward.

https://t.co/h0vLWUfObO

Happy National Ag Day!

Our farmers in Georgia are resilient- especially after facing extensive damage from multiple storms and Hurricane Helene. 

As Vice Chair of @HouseAgGOP, I work each day to support our farmers across Georgia’s Eighth District. https://t.co/zEmcFWnwv5

I supported the continuing resolution to keep our government open today. 

Our fiscal year starts October 1st, and we need to immediately start the appropriations process for the next fiscal year so we don’t end up in this situation again.

President Trump has delivered on his promise to secure our borders and halt the flow of deadly fentanyl and cartels into our country. His administration is also exposing and eliminating tax dollar abuse. 

I look forward to continuing to work with the administration to advance national and global security.

I voted in support of the House Budget Resolution today, which starts the process of extending and expanding the historic policies under President Trump’s 2017 Tax Cuts and Jobs Act paired with reasonable reductions in government spending. The tax cuts in this legislation will save the average family and taxpayer thousands of dollars each year.

Today is the third anniversary of Putin’s full-scale invasion of Ukraine. Never forget that Russia is the aggressor in this war.

I pray that President Trump can broker a peace agreement that respects Ukraine’s territorial sovereignty as a free and independent nation.

We have to put the farm back in the Farm Bill. When the farm economy declines, rural America suffers.

I look forward to his inauguration and moving rapidly to secure our border, reduce the cost of energy, fix our economy, and reduce the deficit.
Mike Johnson is a good man, a good friend, and the best person to lead the House. I proudly supported him for Speaker today, and I have full faith in his leadership this Congress.

and country.

Even after leaving the White House, President Carter maintained his efforts to serve those in need. His work through The Carter Center improved and saved the lives of millions worldwide, nearly eradicating previously common deadly diseases. 2/3

Our nation lost a great Georgian today. President Jimmy Carter was a distinguished public servant, a proud farmer, an accomplished Navy veteran, and a graduate of the US Naval Academy. He lived the American dream and exemplified the ideals of public service to his community 1/3

I voted again in support of our farmers receiving critical disaster relief, economic assistance, and a Farm Bill extension.

I also voted to keep our government open, which I believe is in the best interest of our country.

I voted in favor of the American Relief Act tonight, which included critical disaster relief, economic assistance, and a Farm Bill extension for our farmers.

America’s farmers need help NOW, and our country does not need a costly government shutdown.

I applaud the leadership of Israeli Prime Minister Netanyahu in eliminating terrorist leaders like Yahya Sinwar, the architect of the October 7th attack. The world is a better place with one less terrorist organization leader.

This coalition saved thousands of lives. 

Let me be clear: America will continue to support our ally, Israel, as we stand up for democracy and against terrorism.
